description: This course examines religion in Italy and Germany at several decisive turning points in the past
and today. Students analyze Catholic theology and church practices, from ancient times to the
Renaissance, through site visits and events in Rome (city of the popes) and Florence.  They
examine emergence of Protestantism through activities in the region around Wittenberg, birthplace
of Martin Luther's Reformation.  They compare the influence of religion in Italian and German
culture. Prequisite: BTS-B. Offered during Interim.
